text: Johannes Hans Daniel Jensen (born June 25, 1907 â€“ February 11, 1973) was a German nuclear physicist. During World War II, he worked on the German nuclear energy project, known as the Uranium Club, where he contributed to the separation of uranium isotopes. After the war, Jensen was a professor at the University of Heidelberg. Jensen died on February 11, 1973. title: J. Hans D. Jensen
